intro: Fleurya aestuans var. glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular fleurya, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dune environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
